definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: This problem mainly dwell in the common monosyllabic words.
sentences.chinese: 這一難題，主要存在於一般單音詞中。

sentences.english: The other is the development of acceptation still use the form of single syllable words.
sentences.chinese: 一是詞義發展繼續利用單音詞的形式。

sentences.english: Jinwen "Shangshu" is in the important stage which evolves from monosyllabic words to polysyllabic words.
sentences.chinese: 今文《尚書》正處於單音詞向複音詞演變的重要階段。

sentences.english: The paper stresses the feature to make a study of two-syllabled words.
sentences.chinese: 本文抓住此特點對漢語單音詞雙音化作了研究。

sentences.english: An outstanding feature of ancient Chinese is that the monosyllabic words prevail.
sentences.chinese: 古代漢語一個突出特徵是單音詞佔優勢。
